doc.field: Print matter, mostly, related to arson and fire investigations, and also fire safety/prevention. NYC-specific: FDNY Bureau of Fire Investigation annual reports for 2005-2009; laminated cards FDNY vital statistics CY 2009; Executive Report: Fire Safety Outreach Campaigns in High Risk Communities, July 2005-Feb 2006; "Arson in New York, 1984" report by Mayor Koch's Arson Strike Force, 1985; Division of Fire Investigation (DFI) training bulletins & circulars , ca 1978-80; "Predicting Arson Risk in New York City: A First Report" (1980) and "Manpower Needs for the Investigation of Arson in New York City" (1979), both by Arson Strike Forces; Executive Summary update on the Red Cap Program (anti-arson), circa 1982. Other material is general reference: arson clippings, photocopies of articles, booklets from organizations (Insurance Committee for Arson Control, US Dept of Commerce, Fire Prevention K-3 curriculum from Rochester FD, FBI/Bomb scene Investigation, International Fire Service Training Association/1st edition of Fire Cause Determination; and many small pamphlets on subject), mostly from the 1970s-80s, with some into the 1990s. Spadafora's notebook from fire marshal training school (Oct-Nov 1984), and fire marshal study material and exam questions from late 1970s-mid 80s.
